replies.body:
Yes.

Least of all because you had 3 other punishments before this.

I didn't. No chat restrictions ever. Just a single 14 day ban, which I'd say was deserved. But Getting permabanned for those logs after only being banned once? I don't think so. 

People keep saying "3 other punishments" But I was never on chat restriction.
Then you were _**really**_ bad to skip directly to the 14 day ban. And since you made absolutely no effort to change, you got permabanned
I didn't make an effort to change? Did you read the logs? I wasn't even overbearingly toxic, nor did I say anything to justify a permanent ban on my account.

When you're on the edge of a permaban, you need to do more than not be "overbearingly toxic". Your match will be flagged as negative and punishable regardless of how severe it is; it's either toxic or it isn't.

Also, it takes 3 months for your punishment tier to drop 1 step.
That's straight bs in all seriousness. I did not say anything ban worthy and if you're coming from a logical mindset you'd say the same.

Permaban is the next step after a 14-day ban. The severity of the infraction doesn't matter at all, as long as it's confirmed to be punishable. You had not yet dropped a punishment tier since coming back from the 14-day ban, so any validated report at that point is enough to permanently suspend your account.

Yeah, you were.

When you are on the last step, all it takes is the smallest bit of validated toxicity to permaban you. And you were far from a small bit of toxicity.

So you skipped two tiers of punishment and arrived at the final step prior to a permaban.

You then came back and were being toxic again.

What the hell did you think would happen?
My main point is I wasn't toxic enough to warrant a ban. You have the logs right there, are you saying you'd permaban someone for that? seriously?

The following:

>can we stop doing retarded shit fr now
mumu has downs
gank bot pussy
micah get fucking bot

Seeing as you got reported, the system probably saw these flags.

Hell, if you hadn't been banned prior, this might've been a chat restriction, but you just didn't take reform seriously.

Gank bot pussy, and micah get fucking bot were both said to one of my close friends and bandmates. We were talking back and forth like that all game, that's what we do. I was premade with 4 of my friends. 

I think mumu has downs was the worst thing I said, and even then that shouldn't be permaban.

Someone reported you and Riot doesn't care that you were talking to your "friends". The system sees the flags and acts accordingly.

ffs, just use a 3rd party chat program so you can "joke" around without a care.

So deal with the consequences and .. leave the game maybe?
Nah I'm going to be a professional streamer, play in the lcs and win worlds for NA. Kinda can't leave the game.

Finally, make sure you keep the same behavior. Cos trash talking is baddass, and we all love badass LCS players like Jensen that can body dem fools.

the thing about saying things even with premades is that doesn't actually matter in the eyes of riot. you weren't overly bad, but it still wasn't that good what you said. also, sometimes riot sends you chat logs like these when there are worse cases. after 14 day ban, you are at a much higher risk of being punished in a sense so you have to be really, really careful if you got to that point.

The next step from a 14 day ban is a permanent ban.
I'm not arguing with that, all I'm saying is that what I said as shown above should not have warranted a second ban.

It's not like I said "amumu hang yourself you fucking %%%got, and kill your family too"

If someone is shit talking me, proclaiming they're better and then I dumpster them 5 times in a row and win the game of course I'm saying ggez, because it was an easy game.

"Someone said the game was easy" :'( *Needs Hug*

Okay. It **IS** considered toxic. Man.. I just LOVE repeating myself!

Here's what RiotLyte had to say about it -
> One of our philosophies is to try to not dictate what's OK or not OK in League of Legends unless we absolutely have to. We rely on data like Reports, Honors, social media, the Instant Feedback System and Tribunal to help determine the standards of what the community believes is OK or not OK. This is why all of our systems are intentionally designed to be community-driven, because we want players to have the ability to invest in and shape their own community. In saying this, looking at the data, "GGEZ" is considered a negative term, and is reportable. Players generally agree that the phrase is rarely used in a positive context, and is a pretty sour way to end a match.

[SAUCE](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answers/132069455298)


http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/7844598.gif

Sorry?

The main things were "retard shit" that flagged it and the word "cancer".

Alright, I'll address each of the comments one by one. 

"GG EZ is technically a player saying stuffs to another like "LOL THANKS FOR THE EZ WIN, YOU FKING LOSER HAHA""

That's an over-exaggeration. "ggez" translates to "good game it was easy". People can figure out themselves if they played poorly or not. I'm not saying it's nice, but sometimes the truth hurts.

"Man.. I just LOVE repeating myself!" "Here's what RiotLyte had to say about it"

I just disagree that "ggez" is "Toxic". Rude? Yes. Rude enough to be reportable? Not in my opinion. RiotLyte's opinion does not change my perception that "ggez" is Toxic. He said it was "a negative term" and it is reportable. As I already stated, I don't think it should be reportable. I'll elaborate more at the end.

"GGEZ shows total disrespect to your opponents, and is not in any way sportsmanlike at all. Its only meant to insult and degrade your opponents."

It's what the person thinks about the game. If the shoe fits, then wear it. Why was the game easy? Did the team not work together? Did someone miss too many skill shots or get caught out? "ggez" does not single anyone out itself. (The person who said ggez in this case did single out mumu in this case which was a step too far, but what I'm arguing is that term itself).

"It tilts, at the minimum level though. The main things were "retard shit" that flagged it and the word "cancer"."
I agree it's not the nicest way to end a game, and I'm not defending the guy who said it. I disagree that "ggez" itself is Toxic.

You know what else is rude and unsportsmanly? Disrupting someone from backing. Spamming taunt, joke, laugh, or dance. Spamming the mastery emote. Yet I just can't imagine all these actions being bannable. I find reporting and banning people based on saying "ggez" an excessive measure to something that's really not a big deal at all.

I like how you went on this fucking rant about "ggez" when I said the words that probably flagged it were "retard shit" and "cancer", ignoring the fact you also called people pussies.
You are going on about something nobody gives a shit about and ignoring everything else.
What? I really don't have a clue what you're talking about >.> I'm not the guy who got banned and never called anyone names.
GGEZ shows total disrespect to your opponents, and is not in any way sportsmanlike at all. Its only meant to insult and degrade your opponents.

It's very unsportsmanlike. GG EZ is technically a player saying stuffs to another like "LOL THANKS FOR THE EZ WIN, YOU FKING LOSER HAHA", and it does fall under the Unsportsmanlike Conduct report. Imagine someone in a Tennis or Basketball tournament saying that.
Yes, and they should go ahead and ban this account while they're at it.

I genuinely don't understand what is wrong with you.

How is that unfortunate for me? I could care less. You posted something on the boards that obviously wasn't thought out at all, and I dropped by to give you my opinion.

My work here is done. Hopefully you'll learn your lesson eventually. Best of luck with that.

You said mumu has downs.  If some single mom with a baby like that saw that she'd be super raged.  I could see a perma ban for this being fair.

He build cinderhulk straight into full ap, flashed the wall and ulted me, I killed him and we took a huge lead because of it. It was a wood division play, no one who's intelligent or good at the game would have done that. 

It may be questionable, but in no way do I deserve a permaban for that.

Amumu you take Thunderlords and sometimes even Runic Echos.  The ult can take 30% of someone's life with just a little AP.

I wouldn't play full AP mumu just because AP Sejuani would be more fun, but you can't call someone a spastic cause they tried to delete someone with Amumu.
